intro: Helianthemum italicum, commonly known as the Italian rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are small, fleshy, and gray-green in color, adapted to withstand arid conditions. Helianthemum italicum thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
